Class PlayerCommands

  • java.lang.Object
    • PlayerCommands

  • public class PlayerCommands
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains the command methods of Cryptograms. There are five commands avaliable: i. replace X by Y – replace letter X by letter Y in our attempted solution X = Y – a shortcut for this same command ii. freq – Display the letter frequencies in the encrypted quotation (i.e., how many of letter X appear) like: A: 3 B: 8 C:4 D: 0 E: 12 F: 4 G: 6 (and soon, 7 per line for 4 lines) iii. hint – display one correct mapping that has not yet been guessed iv. exit – Ends the game early v. help – List these commands Finally, if players enter unkonw command, prompt user to enter again.
    Author:
    chaonengquan

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Exit()
      The Exit method for (exit) command call System.exit(0) to exit the program.
      void Freq(java.lang.String encryptedQuote)
      The Freq methond for (freq) command First, store all alphabets with occurence 0 into the new Map, freqMap.
      void Help()
      The Help method for (help) command Print out commands, and the functions of each commands.
      void Hint(java.util.Map<java.lang.Character,java.lang.Character> encryptedKeyMap, java.util.Map<java.lang.Character,java.lang.Character> playerKeyMap)
      The Hint method for (hint) command Display one correct mapping that has not yet been guessed Loop through the value set of the encryptedKeyMap, if the player has not guessed the current letter yet, pick the current letter as hintLetter if the player has guessed the current letter, but not correctly, pick the current letter as hintLetter use private method getKeyByValue() to find out the corresponding original letter.
      void Replace(java.lang.String cmd, LegoBoard myBoard, java.util.Map<java.lang.Character,java.lang.Character> playerKeyMap)
      The Replace method for (replace X by Y) or (X = Y) command First, determine the indexes of the LetterToReplace and Replacement, based on player entered longer version command or shorter verson command.
      void UnknowCommand()
      The UnknowCommand method for unkown(not supported) commands Print out a message to prompt player to enter a different command.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlayerCommands

        public PlayerCommands()

    • Method Detail

      • Replace

        public void Replace(java.lang.String cmd,
                    LegoBoard myBoard,
                    java.util.Map<java.lang.Character,java.lang.Character> playerKeyMap)
        The Replace method for (replace X by Y) or (X = Y) command First, determine the indexes of the LetterToReplace and Replacement, based on player entered longer version command or shorter verson command. Second, call replacePlayerGuessedLetter of the LegoBoard to updated the playerGuessedLetters and playerKeyMap. Finally, print out the updated playerGuessedLetters and encryptedLetters for visualizaion.
        Parameters:
        cmd, - the player's input which contains the LetterToReplace and the Replacement
        myBoard, - the LegoBoard object which needs to be update after replaced the letter
        playerKeyMap, - the player's decryption mapping which will be updated each time Replace() is called

      • Freq

        public void Freq(java.lang.String encryptedQuote)
        The Freq methond for (freq) command First, store all alphabets with occurence 0 into the new Map, freqMap. Second, Iterate over the encryptedQuote, every time encouter a letter, update its occurence with +1. Third, Format print out letter-occurences pair, 7 per line for 4 lines.
        Parameters:
        encryptedQuote -

      • Hint

        public void Hint(java.util.Map<java.lang.Character,java.lang.Character> encryptedKeyMap,
                 java.util.Map<java.lang.Character,java.lang.Character> playerKeyMap)
        The Hint method for (hint) command Display one correct mapping that has not yet been guessed Loop through the value set of the encryptedKeyMap, if the player has not guessed the current letter yet, pick the current letter as hintLetter if the player has guessed the current letter, but not correctly, pick the current letter as hintLetter use private method getKeyByValue() to find out the corresponding original letter. Print out the hintLetter, and the original letter.
        Parameters:
        encryptedKeyMap, - contains the originalLetter-encrypedLetter pairs
        playerKeyMap, - contains the encrypedLetter-playerGuessedLetter pairs

      • Exit

        public void Exit()
        The Exit method for (exit) command call System.exit(0) to exit the program.

      • Help

        public void Help()
        The Help method for (help) command Print out commands, and the functions of each commands.

      • UnknowCommand

        public void UnknowCommand()
        The UnknowCommand method for unkown(not supported) commands Print out a message to prompt player to enter a different command.
